content: scrappiness happiness mittens these mittens are a great way to use up scraps you can use as many colors as you like - the more colors you use the scrappier your mittens will look supplies approx 170 yds dk or light worsted weight yarn size 4 3 5mm circular or double pointed needles ◦ gauge 24 sts x 29 row = 4 square ◦ this makes an adult medium size mitten stitch markers optional cast on 48 sts and join in the round being careful not to twist cuff *k2 p2* repeat for about 20 rounds or desired cuff length feel free to add stripes to the cuff if you like hand follow chart on page 2 changing color as often as you like for rounds 2-17 you may want to place stitch markers after the 24th stitch and before the 25th stitch to mark where to increase for the thumb gusset on round 18 place the 15 sts for the thumb onto a piece of waste yarn continue following the chart for the remainder of the hand decrease rounds 45-55 on the chart round 45 *k2tog k10* repeat to the end of the round round 46 knit all sts round 47 *k2tog k9* repeat to the end of the round round 48 knit all sts round 49 *k2tog k8* repeat to the end of the round round 50 *k2tog k7* repeat to the end of the round round 51 *k2tog k6* repeat to the end of the round round 52 *k2tog k5* repeat to the end of the round round 53 *k2tog k4* repeat to the end of the round round 54 *k2tog k3* repeat to the end of the round round 55 *k2tog* repeat to the end of the round cut yarn leaving a tail pull through remaining sts tighten and secure thumb transfer the 15 sts from waste yarn back onto your needles pick up 3 additional sts follow the thumb chart on page 2 on the last round k2tog across the round cut yarn leaving a tail pull through remaining sts tighten and secure finishing weave in ends and block i hope you enjoy your new mittens please consider making an extra pair of mittens to donate to charity ♥ 55 54 hand chart 53 52 51 50 49 48 47 46 45 44 43 42 41 40 39 38 37 36 35 34 33 32 31 30 29 28 27
